instructions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart casserole dish.
instructions.2: Place carrot and turnip cubes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain; steam dry 1 to 2 minutes.
instructions.3: Return carrot and turnip cubes to the pot. Add flour, 1/4 cup sugar, butter, and salt; mash well.
instructions.4: Whisk milk and eggs together in a bowl; stir into mashed carrot-turnip mixture until combined. Transfer to the prepared dish. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl; sprinkle over mashed mixture.
instructions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is slightly firmed and top has begun to turn golden brown, about 45 minutes.

questions.question: In Step 5, is the oven from Step 1 being used?
Is oven from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is milk from Step 4 still available in Step 5?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 5?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to use the oven in Step 5?
Can we place (Step 2) and bake (Step 5) at the same time?
